alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 2:54PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Albany, west central Platte and south central Converse Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 253 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Laramie Peak, or 27 miles northwest of Wheatland, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laramie Peak and Friend Park Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Laramie Range
